attr.name: Values
attr.content: start | end | left | right | center | justify | match-parent | startend

attr.name: Initial value
attr.content: In CSS3, start; in CSS 2.1, this was user agent-specific, likely depending on writing direction (e.g., left for Western languages like English)

attr.name: Computed value
attr.content: As specified, except in the case of match-parent

attr.name: Note
attr.content: CSS2 included a <length> value that was dropped from CSS 2.1 due to a lack of implementation
